post.description:
This method is public and does not require authentication. 

This is the version of the DokuWiki API. It increases whenever the API definition changes.

When developing a client, you should check this version and make sure you can handle it.

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
This returns the version in the form "Type Date (SHA)". Where type is either
"Release" or "Git" and date is the date of the release or the date of the
last commit. SHA is the short SHA of the last commit - this is only added on
git checkouts.

If no version can be determined "snapshot? update version XX" is returned.
Where XX represents the update version number set in doku.php.

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
This method is public and does not require authentication. 



**See also:**

* [Config Title](https://www.dokuwiki.org/config:title)

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
Returns a Unix timestamp (seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC).

You can use this to compensate for differences between your client's time and the
server's time when working with last modified timestamps (revisions).

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
This method is public and does not require authentication. 

This will use the given credentials and attempt to login the user. This will set the
appropriate cookies, which can be used for subsequent requests.

Use of this mechanism is discouraged. Using token authentication is preferred.

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
Attempt to log out the current user, deleting the appropriate cookies

Use of this mechanism is discouraged. Using token authentication is preferred.

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Info about the currently authenticated user

login.description: The login name of the user

name.description: The full name of the user

mail.description: The email address of the user

groups.description: The groups the user is in

isadmin.description: Whether the user is a super user

ismanager.description: Whether the user is a manager

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
This call allows to check the permissions for a given page/media and user/group combination.
If no user/group is given, the current user is used.

Read the link below to learn more about the permission levels.

**See also:**

* [Acl Background Info](https://www.dokuwiki.org/acl#background_info)

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: List all pages in the given namespace (and below)
post.description:
Setting the `depth` to `0` and the `namespace` to `""` will return all pages in the wiki.

Note: author information is not available in this call.

namespace.description: The namespace to search. Empty string for root namespace [_default: `""`_]

depth.description: How deep to search. 0 for all subnamespaces [_default: `1`_]

hash.description: Whether to include a MD5 hash of the page content [_default: `false`_]

revision.description: The page revision aka last modified timestamp

permission.description: The current user's permissions for this page

hash.description: MD5 sum over the page's content (if available and requested)

author.description: The author of this page revision (if available and requested)

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
This executes a full text search and returns the results. The query uses the standard
DokuWiki search syntax.

Snippets are provided for the first 15 results only. The title is either the first heading
or the page id depending on the wiki's configuration.

**See also:**

* [Search Syntax](https://www.dokuwiki.org/search#syntax)

query.description: The search query as supported by the DokuWiki search

score.description: The number of hits this result got

snippet.description: The HTML formatted snippet in which the search term was found (if available)

revision.description: The page revision aka last modified timestamp

permission.description: The current user's permissions for this page

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
Returns a list of recent changes to wiki pages. The results can be limited to changes newer than
a given timestamp.

Only changes within the configured `$conf['recent']` range are returned. This is the default
when no timestamp is given.

**See also:**

* [Config Recent](https://www.dokuwiki.org/config:recent)

timestamp.description: Only show changes newer than this unix timestamp [_default: `0`_]

ip.description: The IP address from where this change was made

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
Returns the syntax of the given page. When no revision is given, the current revision is returned.

A non-existing page (or revision) will return an empty string usually. For the current revision
a page template will be returned if configured.

Read access is required for the page.

rev.description: Revision timestamp to access an older revision [_default: `0`_]

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Return a wiki page rendered to HTML
post.description:
The page is rendered to HTML as it would be in the wiki. The HTML consist only of the data for the page
content itself, no surrounding structural tags, header, footers, sidebars etc are returned.

References in the HTML are relative to the wiki base URL unless the `canonical` configuration is set.

If the page does not exist, an error is returned.

**See also:**

* [Config Canonical](https://www.dokuwiki.org/config:canonical)

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Return some basic data about a page
post.description:
The call will return an error if the requested page does not exist.

Read access is required for the page.

author.description: whether to include the author information [_default: `false`_]

hash.description: whether to include the MD5 hash of the page content [_default: `false`_]

revision.description: The page revision aka last modified timestamp

permission.description: The current user's permissions for this page

hash.description: MD5 sum over the page's content (if available and requested)

author.description: The author of this page revision (if available and requested)

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Returns a list of available revisions of a given wiki page
post.description:
The number of returned pages is set by `$conf['recent']`, but non accessible revisions
are skipped, so less than that may be returned.

**See also:**

* [Config Recent](https://www.dokuwiki.org/config:recent)

first.description: skip the first n changelog lines, 0 starts at the current revision [_default: `0`_]

ip.description: The IP address from where this change was made

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
This returns a list of links found in the given page. This includes internal, external and interwiki links

If a link occurs multiple times on the page, it will be returned multiple times.

Read access for the given page is needed and page has to exist.

result.description: A list of links found on the given page

type.description: The type of this link: `internal`, `external` or `interwiki`

page.description: The wiki page this link points to, same as `href` for external links

href.description: A hyperlink pointing to the linked target

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
A backlink is a wiki link on another page that links to the given page.

Only links from pages readable by the current user are returned. The page itself
needs to be readable. Otherwise an error is returned.

result.description: A list of pages linking to the given page

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Lock the given set of pages
post.description:
This call will try to lock all given pages. It will return a list of pages that were
successfully locked. If a page could not be locked, eg. because a different user is
currently holding a lock, that page will be missing from the returned list.

You should always ensure that the list of returned pages matches the given list of
pages. It's up to you to decide how to handle failed locking.

Note: you can only lock pages that you have write access for. It is possible to create
a lock for a page that does not exist, yet.

Note: it is not necessary to lock a page before saving it. The `savePage()` call will
automatically lock and unlock the page for you. However if you plan to do related
operations on multiple pages, locking them all at once beforehand can be useful.

pages.description: A list of pages to lock

result.description: A list of pages that were successfully locked

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Unlock the given set of pages
post.description:
This call will try to unlock all given pages. It will return a list of pages that were
successfully unlocked. If a page could not be unlocked, eg. because a different user is
currently holding a lock, that page will be missing from the returned list.

You should always ensure that the list of returned pages matches the given list of
pages. It's up to you to decide how to handle failed unlocking.

Note: you can only unlock pages that you have write access for.

pages.description: A list of pages to unlock

result.description: A list of pages that were successfully unlocked

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
Saves the given wiki text to the given page. If the page does not exist, it will be created.
Just like in the wiki, saving an empty text will delete the page.

You need write permissions for the given page and the page may not be locked by another user.

isminor.description: whether this is a minor edit [_default: `false`_]

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Appends text to the end of a wiki page
post.description:
If the page does not exist, it will be created. If a page template for the non-existant
page is configured, the given text will appended to that template.

The call will create a new page revision.

You need write permissions for the given page.

isminor.description: whether this is a minor edit [_default: `false`_]

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: List all media files in the given namespace (and below)
post.description:
Setting the `depth` to `0` and the `namespace` to `""` will return all media files in the wiki.

When `pattern` is given, it needs to be a valid regular expression as understood by PHP's
`preg_match()` including delimiters.
The pattern is matched against the full media ID, including the namespace.

**See also:**

* https://www.php.net/manual/en/reference.pcre.pattern.syntax.php

namespace.description: The namespace to search. Empty string for root namespace [_default: `""`_]

pattern.description: A regular expression to filter the returned files [_default: `""`_]

depth.description: How deep to search. 0 for all subnamespaces [_default: `1`_]

hash.description: Whether to include a MD5 hash of the media content [_default: `false`_]

revision.description: The media revision aka last modified timestamp

permission.description: The current user's permissions for this file

isimage.description: Wether this is an image file

hash.description: MD5 sum over the file's content (if available and requested)

author.description: The author of this page revision (if available and requested)

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
Returns a list of recent changes to media files. The results can be limited to changes newer than
a given timestamp.

Only changes within the configured `$conf['recent']` range are returned. This is the default
when no timestamp is given.

**See also:**

* [Config Recent](https://www.dokuwiki.org/config:recent)

timestamp.description: Only show changes newer than this unix timestamp [_default: `0`_]

ip.description: The IP address from where this change was made

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description:
Returns the content of the given media file. When no revision is given, the current revision is returned.

**See also:**

* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Return info about a media file
post.description:
The call will return an error if the requested media file does not exist.

Read access is required for the media file.

author.description: whether to include the author information [_default: `false`_]

hash.description: whether to include the MD5 hash of the media content [_default: `false`_]

revision.description: The media revision aka last modified timestamp

permission.description: The current user's permissions for this file

isimage.description: Wether this is an image file

hash.description: MD5 sum over the file's content (if available and requested)

author.description: The author of this page revision (if available and requested)

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Returns the pages that use a given media file
post.description:
The call will return an error if the requested media file does not exist.

Read access is required for the media file.

Since API Version 13

result.description: A list of pages linking to the given page

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Returns a list of available revisions of a given media file
post.description:
The number of returned files is set by `$conf['recent']`, but non accessible revisions
are skipped, so less than that may be returned.

Since API Version 14







@author

**See also:**

* [Config Recent](https://www.dokuwiki.org/config:recent)

first.description: skip the first n changelog lines, 0 starts at the current revision [_default: `0`_]

ip.description: The IP address from where this change was made

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Uploads a file to the wiki
post.description:
The file data has to be passed as a base64 encoded string.

**See also:**

* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64

overwrite.description: Should an existing file be overwritten? [_default: `false`_]

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Deletes a file from the wiki
post.description: You need to have delete permissions for the file.

post.description: Sends the given question to the LLM and returns the answer, including the used sources.

query.description: The question to ask the LLM

model.description: The model to use, if empty the default model is used [_default: `""`_]

lang.description: Language code to override preferUIlanguage setting. "auto" to force autodetection. [_default: `""`_]

answer.description: The answer provided by the LLM

sources.description: The sources provided to the model to answer the questions

page.description: The page id of the source

title.description: The title of the source page

id.description: The chunk id of the source (pages are split into chunks)

score.description: The similarity score of this source to the query (between 0 and 1)

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.summary: Get page chunks similar to a given query
post.description:
Uses the given query to find similar pages in the wiki. Returns the most similar chunks.

This call returns chunks, not pages. So a page may returned multiple times when different chunks of it
are similar to the query.

Note that this call may return less results than requested depending on the used vector store.

max.description: Maximum number of results to return. -1 for default set in config [_default: `-1`_]

threshold.description: Minimum similarity score to return results for. -1 for default set in config [_default: `-1`_]

lang.description: Language code to override preferUIlanguage setting. "auto" to force autodetection. [_default: `""`_]

page.description: The page id of the source

title.description: The title of the source page

id.description: The chunk id of the source (pages are split into chunks)

score.description: The similarity score of this source to the query (between 0 and 1)

error.description: Error object in case of an error

name.description: The display name of this extension

version.description: The installed version/date of this extension

isBundled.description: Whether this extension is bundled with DokuWiki

isGitControlled.description: Whether this extension is under git control

componentTypes.description: The component types this plugin provides

lastUpdate.description: The last available remote update date

downloadURL.description: The download URL for this extension

post.description:
If no password is provided, a password is auto generated. If the user can't be created
by the auth backend a return value of `false` is returned. You need to check this return
value rather than relying on the error code only.

Superuser permission are required to create users.

groups.description: The groups the user should be in

password.description: The user's password, empty for autogeneration [_default: `""`_]

notify.description: Whether to send a notification email to the user [_default: `false`_]

result.description: Wether the user was successfully created

error.description: Error object in case of an error

post.description: You need to be a superuser to delete users.

user.description: The login name of the user to delete

result.description: wether the user was successfully deleted

error.description: Error object in case of an error
